description:
Do you assume your modern web framework has all the built in security protection you might need? Think again. Cross-site scripting (XSS) and SQL injection are still common in today’s web applications. Join us for a discussion of the OWASP Top 10 and live demos of exploits using the OWASP Juice Shop modern web application.

• What we'll do
5:30-6:30 Meet and Greet / Dinner (Pizza and Drinks Provided)
6:30-8:00 Main Topic Discussion
8:00-9:00 Mingle

• What we’ll cover
Let's break a web app and learn about security

* Livestream
To be announced

• What to bring
Yourself, a friend, and some excitement to learn!
how_to_find_us: Take the elevator up to the 8th floor.
name: A Scripting Attack Walks Into a Web App

description: JAMstack Denver is back! Our main presentation for June will be Developing for Scale on the Front End by Doug Whitney "What does scalability mean when building and delivering front-end applications? In this presentation, we’ll look at some of the typical challenges of scale that come with developing single page web apps and talk about how to avoid optimizing in the wrong direction." Sounds awesome, right? Zach Brooks will also be giving us a short presentation on his experience building a portfolio site with Gridsome - sweet! Come by from 6 to 6:30 for networking, pizza and drinks, presentations from 6:30 to 7:45, and then some more networking! JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct
how_to_find_us: Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station
name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - June

description:
Hello Designers and Product Managers,

In the world of software, there are many layers to creating an amazing product. Within that world, two roles that intersect are designers and PM's/PO's. The varying responsibilities and differing focuses of these two groups can cause internal struggles around how to build the best software/experience.

We are excited to host four experienced individuals in Denver. They will talk to us about their approach to working together, problem solving, and when necessary, entertaining healthy debate that allows them to reach business goals while creating great user experiences.

Speakers-
Kristin Lee: Director of Digital Platform at Transamerica
Hadlie Hahn: Lead Digital Designer at Transamerica
Jesus Salcedo: Manager of Experience Design at Vendavo
Jordan Hahn: Senior Product Manager at Vendavo

Agenda
5:30 Mingle & Mix over food and drinks
6:00 Intro's
6:15-8pm - Round table discussion

8:05 Q& A / Finish up cleaning and head out ( we want to be respectful of our host studio and leave before 9. However, we encourage our members to build professional relationships and continue the conversation via our slack channel, denverux.slack.com, or IRL over coffee/ drinks )

We are also proud to announce our newest partnership with Vendavo. They will open up their downtown office to host us with food & drinks for the evening.
https://www.vendavo.com/

Location:
Vendavo[masked]th Street, Suite 800 Denver, CO 80202
name: Healthy Debate - PM's and Designers working together

description:
Continuing our JS Frameworks series, Tommy Gaessler, Developer Advocate at Zoom Video Communications, will be walking us through building a todo list app from scratch! Feel free to bring your laptops and code along or just watch and see all the cool features of Angular!

From installing Angular, to building a working ToDo List App (utilizing local storage and Angular's Material Design framework) you will leave with a great overview of Angular and how its different from other popular front-end frameworks!

Before Zoom, Tommy was the Frontend Developer at Apostrophe.health (a Techstars Boulder company currently located in RiNo). He has 3+ years of Angular experience building out Apostrophe’s SaaS Intelligent Health Benefits Platform as well as other fun Angular projects like skiride.com!

Zoom is hiring for 2 positions in Denver! Both a Mobile and Desktop SDK Developer Advocate https://jobs.lever.co/zoom/a0dceba7-265c-46f7-b9c3-e915fae9886a

Apostrophe is also hiring a Frontend Developer in Denver (RiNo)! https://www.apostrophe.health/careers/front-end-developer/

6:30 - 7:00 - Networking and socializing
7:00 - 8:00 - Presentation
8:00 - 8:30 - More networking and socializing

The always generous Code Talent (www.code-talent.com) will be providing the space and the beer. Hope to see you there.
name: Todo: Learn How to Build an Angular App (JS Frameworks Series)

description:
Come hang out with fellow members of the growing Denver/Boulder tech scene. Everyone is welcome. Come to learn, make contacts or discuss your latest project. No speaker, no agenda, no code knowledge necessary, just drinks.

Monthly Happy Hour. We are always open to suggestions for new venues to host the happy hour. Please feel free to message the us with any ideas.
how_to_find_us: We'll be in the private area of the back patio, the grill should be going for grub as well.
name: June Develop Happy Hour

description: TBD
name: Topic TBD - Downtown

description:
6:15 pm: Intro and What's going on in JavaScript Land? (20min)

We'll be talking about new/exciting things going on in the industry. If you have something you think we should mention, feel free to tweet us @DenverScript (https://twitter.com/denverscript).

6:35 pm: Job Announcements

Anyone with a job opening can come up to the front and announce it to the group.

6:45 pm: Shorter Presentation(8 - 10min):

(TBD)

7:00 pm: Longer Presentation(20 - 30min):

Game Development for Front End Developers - Drew Conley

Your front end skills aren't limited to just websites and apps - you can make games, too! We'll explore the process of wrapping a browser-based JavaScript game with Electron for gaming markets like Steam. If you're a front end person interested in game development, this talk will help you bridge the gap.

Drew is an easy-going front end developer in the Denver area. He enjoys drinking a lot of coffee, petting good dogs, and programming things.

Socialize:

We'll have beer and pizza! We'll also allow people to announce any job opportunities they may have at that time so you can socialize with potential applicants.
name: Monthly DenverScript Meetup

description:
Hello Fellow Designers,

It's hot in the Summer in the City. Let's go grab some drinks at our favorite local Summer Spot, Ratio Beerworks!
Bring your best boardshorts, doggies, and sunnies. See you on the Patio.

Cheers,
Zoe, Seth, Morgan, and gang.

description:
So you have mad skills and are ready for the world of technology. Or perhaps you've been around but are looking to brush up your interviewing skills. Either way come to Denver Modern Web and listen to Megan Spans, technical recruiter for Slalom Consulting, talk about what works...and what doesn't when job hunting.

• What we'll do
5:30-6:30 Meet and Greet / Dinner (Pizza and Drinks Provided)
6:30-8:00 Main Topic Discussion
8:00-9:00 Mingle

• What we’ll cover
Megan will be talking the wild world of recruiting

* Livestream
To be announced

• What to bring
Yourself, a friend, and some excitement to learn!
how_to_find_us: Take the elevator up to the 8th floor.
name: Job Hunting Secrets Revealed
